DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Plasma And Serum Aliquot Collected Identifier
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The serial identifier of the aliquot of the plasma and serum specimen collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Plasma And Serum Aliquot Serial Number Identifier
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed._Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight._A unique identifier assigned to a member of a series of similar items._One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Plasma And Serum Aliquot Serial Number Identifier
Property.preferredDefinition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.:A unique identifier assigned to a member of a series of similar items.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.
A unique identifier assigned to a member of a series of similar items.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities
